qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: The Alpenbock Scrapbook, Volume I
qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The Alpenbock Climbing Club scrapbooks document the activities of the Alpenbock Climbing Club dating from mostly 1961-1964. Early Alpenbock Climbing Club members consisted primarily of recent graduates of Olympus High School and included Rick Reese, Ted Wilson, Ralph Tingey, Bob Irvine, Richard Wallin, Dave Wood, Rich and Dick Ream, Larry Evans, Court Richards, Milt Hokanson, and Robert "Bob" Stout. Scrapbook contents were compiled primarily by club historians: Ralph Hurst Tingey, Robert "Bob" Bruschke, Ted Wilson, and Richard "Rich" Ream. Scrapbooks contain black-and-white photographs taken by club members during their climbs. Other material in the scrapbooks includes: clippings from local Salt Lake City newspapers and climbing magazines; typed reflections from club members about climbs; written descriptions and drawings of climbing routes; communications and agendas related to club activities; and other ephemera, including a cloth Alpenbock Club patch. Subjects include climbing routes and climb reports; search and rescue operations and safety education; and snow and ice climbing. Locations include: Wasatch Range, Utah; Grand Teton National Park, Wyoming; Wind River Range, Wyoming; Sierra Nevada mountain range, California. Areas depicted within the Wasatch-Cache National Forest in Salt Lake County, Utah include: Little Cottonwood Canyon, Bell's Canyon, and Lone Peak Cirque. Please note: some terminology in these books may be outdated and offensive.
qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Wooden book covers
Rock climbers--Utah; Rock climbing--Utah; Athletic clubs; Mountaineering; Snow and ice climbing
qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:spatial: Alpenbock Loop, Salt Lake County, Utah, United States, 40.57445, -111.77622; Little Cottonwood Canyon, Salt Lake County, Utah, United States, 40.57275, -111.77296
qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:ispartof: P1566 Alpenbock Climbing Club scrapbook collection
qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Alpenbock Climbing Club; Tingey, Ralph Hurst; Bruschke, Robert; Wilson, Ted; Ream, Richard

qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Shipments made to American Smetling and Refining [01]
qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Black and white photograph of a scene at a mine near Goldstone, California, in the Mojave Desert about 33 miles north of Barstow, in 1932. The photos were sent with a letter dated July 13, 1932, from T. Frank Turner in Cambridge, Mass., to Congressman Frank H. Foss in Washington, D.C., discussing shipments made from the mine to the American Refining Company at Garfield, Utah.
qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Mines and mineral resources--California--San Bernardino County--Photographs; Goldstone (Calif.)--Photographs
qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:ispartof: P1710 Calumet Mining and Refining Company photograph collection

qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: James M. Bird photos of all terrain vehicle [01]
qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Black and white photograph of a hydraulically-driven all-terrain vehicle designed by James M. Bird for navigating difficult terrain in a mine. It has independent suspension for each of six wheels. The vehicle was eleven feet long and eight feet wide, and weighed 7,000 pounds. The photos were sent with a letter by James M. Bird of Tulsa, OK, dated March 6, 1970, to Mr. C. H. Likins of Calumet Mining & Refining Company in Salt Lake City, Utah.
qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: All terrain vehicles--Photographs; Mineral industries--Equipment and supplies--Photographs
qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:ispartof: P1710 Calumet Mining and Refining Company photograph collection

It has independent suspension for each of six wheels. The vehicle was eleven feet long and eight feet wide, and weighed 7,000 pounds. The photos were sent with a letter by James M. Bird of Tulsa, OK, dated March 6, 1970, to Mr. C. H. Likins of Calumet Mining & Refining Company in Salt Lake City, Utah.
qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: All terrain vehicles--Photographs; Mineral industries--Equipment and supplies--Photographs
qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:ispartof: P1710 Calumet Mining and Refining Company photograph collection
